DOC.brief_summary: To compare single-dose bioavailability Par Bristol-Myers Squibb Buspirone HCl Tablets
DOC.brief_title: Bioavailability Study ( Buspar ) Buspirone HCl Tablets Under Fasting Fed Conditions
DOC.detailed_description: To compare single-dose bioavailability Par Bristol-Myers Squibb ( Buspar ) 15 mg buspirone HCl tablet , follow administration 30 mg dose , fed condition . In addition , bioavailability Par product compare fed fasting condition .
DOC.criteria: Healthy male volunteer , 1845 year age Weighing least 60 kg , within 10 % ideal weight ( Table `` Desirable Weights Adults '' , metropolitan Life Insurance Company , 1983 ) Physical examination laboratory test hematologic , hepatic renal function . Medically healthy subject clinically normal laboratory profile enrol study History presence significant cardiovascular , pulmonary , hepatic , renal , hematologic , gastrointestinal , endocrine , immunologic , dermatologic , neurologic psychiatric disease . In addition , presence alcoholism drug abuse within past year : hypersensitivity idiosyncratic reaction buspirone HCl . Subjects receive monoamine oxidase inhibitor . Subjects abnormal diet ( whatever reason ) 28 day precede study . Subjects , completion study , would donate excess 500 mL blood 14 day , 500750 mL blood 14 day ( unless approve Principal Investigator , 1000 mL blood 90 day , 1250 mL blood 120 day , 1500 mL blood 180 day , 2000 mL blood 270 day , 2500 mL blood 1 year . Subjects participate another clinical trial 28 day study start .
